titles.title: For the relief of James B. Stanley.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Administrative Law and Governmental Relations.
Reported by the Committee on Judiciary. H. Rept. 103-221.

calendar.text: Placed on the Private Calendar, Calendar No. 4.

action.text: Called up from the Private Calendar for consideration.

ORDER OF LEGISLATIVE BUSINESS - Mr. Sensenbrenner objected to moving the bill to engrossment and third reading and demanded that the question be put. Subsequently, by voice vote, the Chair announced that the noes had prevailed, resulting in a demand by Mr. Boucher for a roll call on the question.
Mr. Boucher moved to proceed to engrossment and third reading.
On motion to proceed to engrossment and third reading Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 390 - 1 (Roll no. 436).
The bill was engrossed and read for the third time by title. Subsequently, the Chair put the question on final passage.

POSTPONE FINAL PASSAGE - The Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered on the question of final passage of the bill. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 5 of rule I, the Chair postponed further proceedings until later in the day.

vote.text: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 425 - 0, 1 Present (Roll no. 438).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Courts and Administrative Practice.
Subcommittee on Courts and Administrative Practice. Approved for full committee consideration without amendment favorably.

calendar.text: Committee on Judiciary. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Judiciary. Reported to Senate by Senator Biden without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 689.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 2/3/1993--Introduced. Directs the Secretary of the Treasury to pay a specified sum to a named individual in full satisfaction of all claims against the United States for injuries resulting from the administration to such individual of lysergic acid diethylamide by U.S. Army personnel.
